plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are perennial shrubs known for their large, fragrant flowers. They vary widely in size and color, making them beloved in gardens worldwide. In temperate climates, many rose varieties bloom profusely in late spring through summer.
plants.location: Widely cultivated globally, especially Northern Hemisphere temperate zones
plants.funFact: Roses have been symbols of love and beauty for millennia and have been cultivated for over 5,000 years.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: The sacred lotus is an aquatic perennial known for its large, fragrant pink or white flowers that bloom above the water surface. It is culturally significant in Asia and has unique thermoregulatory properties, maintaining flower temperature to attract pollinators.
plants.location: Asia, especially Indian subcontinent and East Asia
plants.funFact: Lotus flowers can regulate their internal temperature, staying warmer than the surrounding air to attract beetle pollinators.

plants.name: Erythronium americanum
plants.description: A woodland wildflower featuring nodding yellow flowers with mottled leaves that resemble trout skin. It emerges in early spring, but in some northern and alpine regions, it can still be found blooming into late June.
plants.funFact: Yellow Trout Lily can take up to 7 years to flower from seed and often spreads vegetatively via underground bulbs.

plants.name: Puya chilensis
plants.description: A striking bromeliad producing tall, spiky inflorescences with vibrant turquoise-blue flowers. Native to arid regions of Chile, it blooms in late spring through early summer, attracting hummingbirds and other pollinators.
plants.funFact: Puya chilensis can grow to over 3 meters tall and is one of the largest bromeliads in the world.
